page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Children are told that History is His Story therefore Local History is that of our forefathers and we need to preserve not only the evidence but also the knowledge of their existence for they were the Celts,Romans,Normans and Danes.The Celts were here before, during and after the Roman occupation and their presence is reflected in the Place Names in the locality.Wigpool (Weeg Pool) meaning Wooded Hole. Moors (mwr+s) meaning Broken down Building .The Welsh language is informative and these two references refer to the 'Roman Hole'i.e.their source of iron ore supply and a relict of Roman or Norman occupation.The Lea is derived from land cleared by the Romans for crops for the village was on the periphery of the Roman Town of Ariconium or Urarc in Welsh meaning Precious Metal i.e.Iron.
